Package edu.bu.labs.infexf.distance

Class DistanceMetric

java.lang.Object
edu.bu.labs.infexf.distance.DistanceMetric
public class DistanceMetric extends Object
A class to calculate different distance metrics (i.e. distance functions). This class contains a few popular ones such as chebyshev, manhattan, and euclidean. For arbitrary vector norms, you can use the pDistance static method where you must supply a value of p.
See Also:
  • chebyshevDistance(edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex, edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex)
  • manhattanDistance(edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex, edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex)
  • euclideanDistance(edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex, edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex)
  • pDistance(edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex, edu.bu.labs.infexf.graph.Vertex, int)

  • Constructor Details

    • DistanceMetric

      public DistanceMetric()

  • Method Details

    • chebyshevDistance

      public static float chebyshevDistance(Vertex a, Vertex b)
      A static method to compute the chebyshev distance between two Vertex objects. The chebyshev distance is defined as: max(abs(a.x - b.x), abs(a.y - b.y))
      Parameters:
      a - One Vertex
      b - Another Vertex
      Returns:
      The chebyshev distance between the two Vertex objects.

    • manhattanDistance

      public static float manhattanDistance(Vertex a, Vertex b)
      A static method to compute the manhattan distance between two Vertex objects. The manhattan distance is defined as: abs(a.x - b.x) + abs(a.y - b.y)^2
      Parameters:
      a - One Vertex
      b - Another Vertex
      Returns:
      The manhattan distance between the two Vertex objects.

    • euclideanDistance

      public static float euclideanDistance(Vertex a, Vertex b)
      A static method to compute the euclidean distance between two Vertex objects. The euclidean distance is defined as: sqrt((a.x - b.x)^2 + (a.y - b.y)^2)
      Parameters:
      a - One Vertex
      b - Another Vertex
      Returns:
      The euclidean distance between the two Vertex objects.

    • pDistance

      public static float pDistance(Vertex a, Vertex b, int p)
      A static method to compute the p-norm between two Vertex objects. The p-norm is defined as: ((a.x - b.x)^p + (a.y - b.y)^p)^(1/p)
      Parameters:
      a - One Vertex
      b - Another Vertex
      p - value of p (p=2 corresponds to euclidean, p=1 corresponds to manhattan)
      Returns:
      The p-norm between the two Vertex objects.
